definition[0]: when a stock or supply of something is used
example[0]: Strong demand for oil has resulted in a large drawdown in world stocks.
definition[1]: when someone obtains money as part of a loan that has already been agreed or uses money that they have saved
example[1]: an income drawdown plan that allows you to keep your fund invested while drawing a regular income
definition[2]: a reduction in the value of an investment
example[2]: Even if an investor says he is prepared for a 30% drawdown, he always finds it a worse experience then he imagined when it happens.
